Sentence.sentence: No wonder parents worry their own kids might spin out of control once they hit the turbulent waters of adolescence.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: There is not any one-hit wonder, and  there will not be one for years to come, said Gary Shapiro, president and chief executive of the Consumer  Technology  Association  ( ' , CTA).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The electronic industry is maturing even though no wonder products hit the market.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: No wonder only 13% of employees worldwide feel  engaged in their occupation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: No wonder it has become fashionable to denounce many universities as little more than elaborate con-tricks ( ' , 骗术).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many consumers wonder about the necessity of having their fitness monitored.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Small wonder that an Indian legend described Devils Tower as being formed by supernatural powers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Charles, as a singer, do you ever make yourself cry when you sing? I wonder if you can tell me a little bit about your job as a radio announcer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder what they are protesting against.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if you could say then in a few words what the advantages are for a girl at a single-sex school
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: We are, supposedly, creating a technological wonder world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I was wondering if the one Prof. Smith
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: They are wondering why Act Two is odd and how it differs from Act One
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: No wonder they don't get along.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: You know I've often wondered why people laugh at the picture of a big belly businessman slipping on a banana skin and falling on his bottom.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I can't wait to see them, I'm wondering if the shots I took are as good as I thought.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "There is not any one-hit wonder, and there will not be one for years to come," said Gary Shapiro, president and chief executive of the Consumer Technology Association CT.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: For Droujkova, high-level math is important, and what it could use in American classrooms is an injection of childlike wonder.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if you can tell me a little bit about your job as a radio announcer.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: It's no wonder that new applications for the Internet of Things are moving ahead fast when almost every new device we buy has a plug on the end of it or a wireless connection to the internet.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It's no wonder these companies employ teams of people focused on engineering their services to be as engaging as possible.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: No wonder it has become fashionable to denounce many universities as little more than elaborate con-tricks.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"奇迹"之意。
means: marvel ： 侧重异乎寻常，奇怪，从而使人好奇。
miracle ： 一般指被认为是人力所办不到的奇异之事。
wonder ： 通常指使人惊奇的事迹、人物或景观，主要指人创造的奇迹。
phenomenon ： 指罕见的现象或奇人、奇事。

Sentence.sentence: A child's day is filled with fascination, newness and wonder.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: As children, we thought very little about these educational wonders.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: But Shelly-Ann was to prove that she was anything but a one-hit wonder.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: For Pahlsson, its return was a wonder.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder how he would react if I were to read my newspaper out loud on the train, I have never had the courage to do it, though.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if you could send someone to have a look at it.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if you could tell me how to find a place to have my shoes mended.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: In the passage, the author intends to tell us we should fill our senses to feel the wonders of the world.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 题设

Sentence.sentence: Miss Chen, I was wondering if you could find out how I did on the middle-term exam?
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Scientists wonder how much the brain gets involved.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Stratford: includes a guided tour exploring much of the Shakespeare wonder.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: We are facing today a strange new world and we are all wondering what we are going to do with it.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: We lose our sense of wonder.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Wondering how my mum could consume them so quickly, I began observing her daily routine for two weeks.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Working with Naomi did wonders for Steve.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: When our ancestors were hunters and gatherers 10,000 years ago, they didn’t have time to wonder much about anything besides finding food.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Unhappy parents rarely are provoked to wonder if they shouldn’t have had kids, but unhappy childless folks are bothered with the message that children are the single most important thing in the world: obviously their misery must be a direct result of the gaping baby-size holes in their lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In a society that so persistently celebrates procreation, is it any wonder that admitting you regret having children is equivalent to admitting you support kitten-killing ? It doesn’t seem quite fair,then, to compare the regrets of parents to the regrets of the children.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But it’s interesting to wonder if the images we see every week of stress-free, happiness-enhancing parenthood aren’t in some small, subconscious way contributing to our own dissatisfactions with the actual experience, in the same way that a small part of us hoped getting “ the Rachel” might make us look just a little bit like Jennifer Aniston.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Take a moment or two to wonder at those marvels.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "The first thing needed for innovation is a fascination with wonder," says Dawna Markova, author of "The Open mind".
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Research on animal intelligence also makes me wonder what experiments animals would perform on humans if they had the chance.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Research on animal intelligence always makes us wonder just how smart humans are.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

sentences.en: Jacelin says he didn't do it, but I still wonder.
sentences.cn: 杰斯林说他没那样做, 可我仍然怀疑。

sentences.en: They waited and wondered what to do.
sentences.cn: 他们等待着, 不知干什么。

sentences.en: I wonder none of you were hurt.
sentences.cn: 我纳闷怎么你们谁也没受伤。

sentences.en: I was just wondering.
sentences.cn: 我只不过是好奇而已。

sentences.en: I wonder how you came to miss your way.
sentences.cn: 我想知道你是怎样迷路的。

means.word_mean: 惊奇, 惊叹, 惊异, 惊诧

sentences.en: He felt wonder mingled with awe at the Grand Canyon.
sentences.cn: 面对着大峡谷, 他又惊奇又敬畏。

sentences.en: He's a wonder with the way he arranges everything without any help.
sentences.cn: 他不要任何帮忙就把事情样样办妥, 真是个奇才。

means.word_mean: 奇观, 奇景, 奇迹, 奇事

sentences.en: Books are filled with many wonders.
sentences.cn: 书中充满了新奇的事物。

means.word_mean: （礼貌地提问或请人做事时说）
对…感到好奇；对…感到惊讶；急欲知道

sentences.en: He wondered what had happened.
sentences.cn: 他想知道发生了什么事。

means.word_mean: 询问；问(与 of 连用)

sentences.en: I wonder at your allowing her to buy the expensive clothes.
sentences.cn: 我对你答应她买这么贵的衣服感到吃惊。

data.mean: （礼貌地提问或请人做事时说）
奇迹；奇观；奇事；奇妙之处
能人；奇才；有特效的东西
do wonders (for sb/sth) （为某人 / 替某事）创造奇迹；产生神奇作用

sentence.cn: 科学家们想知道大脑参与了多少。
sentence.en: Scientists wonder how much the brain gets involved.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

sentence.cn: 我想知道您是否可以告诉我如何找到修理鞋子的地方。
sentence.en: I wonder if you could tell me how to find a place to have my shoes mended.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 听力 原文

mean.mean: （礼貌地提问或请人做事时说）

jx.jx_cn_mean: 并不奇怪；不足为奇；十分正常

lj.lj_ly: &B{it is little wonder that} the fax machine is so popular.
lj.lj_ls: 传真机如此受欢迎并不奇怪。

jx.jx_en_mean: something that attracts enthusiastic interest for a short while but is then ignored or forgotten
jx.jx_cn_mean: 轰动一时的东西（但很快就会被忘记）

jx.jx_en_mean: an exclamation of great surprise at something pleasing
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于看到令人高兴的东西时发出的感叹］永远都有奇迹

jx.jx_en_mean: have a very beneficial effect on someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 创奇迹；产生奇妙的作用

lj.lj_ly: a good night's sleep can work wonders for mind and body.
lj.lj_ls: 一夜好眠对身心都能产生奇妙的作用。

jx.jx_en_mean: As a cause for surprise; surprisingly.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 作为惊奇的原因；惊奇地

entry.def: If you wonder about something, you think about it, either because it interests you and you want to know more about it, or because you are worried or suspicious about it.
entry.tran: 感到疑惑;纳闷儿;想弄明白

example.ex: I wondered what that noise was...
example.tran: 我纳闷儿那是什么声音。

example.ex: 'He claims to be her father,' said Max. 'We've been wondering about him.'...
example.tran: “他自称是她父亲，”马克斯说，“我们一直都在怀疑他。”

entry.def: If you wonder at something, you are very surprised about it or think about it in a very surprised way.

example.ex: He liked to sit and wonder at all that had happened...
example.tran: 他喜欢坐着对发生的一切惊叹不已。

example.ex: Walk down Castle Street, admire our little jewel of a cathedral, then wonder at the castle...
example.tran: 沿着城堡街走下去，欣赏我们视若珍宝的教堂，继而叹服于城堡的壮观。

entry.def: If you say that it is a wonder that something happened, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.

example.ex: It's a wonder that it took almost ten years...
example.tran: 这差不多用了10年的时间，真是桩奇事。

example.ex: The wonder is that Olivier was not seriously hurt.
example.tran: 奥利维尔伤得不重，真是奇迹。

entry.def: Wonder is a feeling of great surprise and pleasure that you have, for example when you see something that is very beautiful, or when something happens that you thought was impossible.

example.ex: 'That's right!' Bobby exclaimed in wonder. 'How did you remember that?'...
example.tran: “对呀！”博比惊奇地叫道。“你是怎么想起那件事的？”

example.ex: I was expressing some amazement and wonder at her good fortune...
example.tran: 我对她的好运既惊奇又感叹。

entry.def: A wonder is something that causes people to feel great surprise or admiration.

example.ex: ...a lecture on the wonders of space and space exploration.
example.tran: 关于宇宙奇观和太空探险的讲座

example.ex: ...the wonder of seeing his name in print...
example.tran: 看见他的名字出现在出版物上的诧异

entry.def: If you refer, for example, to a young man as a wonder boy, or to a new product as a wonder drug, you mean that they are believed by many people to be very good or very effective.
entry.tran: 神奇的;奇妙的;有奇效的

example.ex: Mickelson was hailed as the wonder boy of American golf...
example.tran: 米克尔森被誉为美国高尔夫球界的神奇小子。

example.ex: Dr Williams describes it as a potential wonder drug.
example.tran: 威廉斯医生称其可能会成为特效药。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a nine-day wonder or a one-day wonder, you disapprove of the fact that they are attracting so much interest and attention, because you think that their popularity will only last for a very short time.
entry.tran: 昙花一现的人(或事物);惊艳一时的人(或事物)

example.ex: Harry dismissed his old friend's speech as 'a nine-day wonder'...
example.tran: 哈里对老朋友的讲话不屑一顾，称之“火不了多久”。

example.ex: Some supernova researchers wondered if it might be just a nine-day wonder.
example.tran: 有些超新星研究者怀疑，这可能只是昙花一现。

entry.def: You can say 'I wonder' if you want to be very polite when you are asking someone to do something, or when you are asking them for their opinion or for information.
entry.tran: (用于礼貌地请人做事、征求意见或打听消息时)不知…，请问…

example.ex: I was just wondering if you could help me...
example.tran: 不知您是否能帮我个忙。

example.ex: I just wonder what you make of all that...
example.tran: 我只是纳闷儿你是怎么看待这一切的。

entry.def: If you say 'no wonder', 'little wonder', or 'small wonder', you mean that something is not surprising.

example.ex: No wonder my brother wasn't feeling well...
example.tran: 难怪我兄弟感觉不舒服了。

example.ex: Under such circumstances, it is little wonder that they experience difficulties...
example.tran: 在这种情形下，他们遇到困难就不足为怪了。

entry.def: You can say 'No wonder' when you find out the reason for something that has been puzzling you for some time.
entry.tran: （表示找出某事的原因）难怪，怪不得

example.ex: Brad was Jane's brother! No wonder he reminded me so much of her!
example.tran: 布拉德是简的兄弟！怪不得他老是让我想起她呢！

entry.def: If you say that a person or thing works wonders or does wonders, you mean that they have a very good effect on something.

example.ex: A few moments of relaxation can work wonders...
example.tran: 放松一会儿就可以收到奇效。

example.ex: Rushton has done wonders for the industry.
example.tran: 拉什顿创造了行业奇迹。

means.word_mean: 1. the feeling aroused by something strange and surprising
2. something that causes feelings of wonder;
3. a state in which you want to learn more about something
1. have a wish or desire to know something;

sentences.sentence: "He wondered who had built this beautiful church"

means.word_mean: 2. place in doubt or express doubtful speculation;

sentences.sentence: "I wonder whether this was the right thing to do"
"she wondered whether it would snow tonight"
"We marvelled at the child's linguistic abilities"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wundor (noun), wundrian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wonder and German Wunder, of unknown ultimate origin

sentences.cn: 医学专家们认为,身体上的接触是具有一种奇妙的治疗功效.
sentences.en: Doctors say that body touch is a kind of medicine that can work wonders.

sentences.en: I began to wonder whether I had been deluded.

sentences.cn: 母亲怀疑自己是否经得起再动一次手术.

sentences.en: Some former colleagues wonder whether the irrepressible dealmaker will have enough to do.

sentences.cn: 我很想知道他是谁, 从哪里来,来干什么.
sentences.en: I wonder who he is, where he came from and why he came.

sentences.en: No, I was just wondering.

sentences.cn: 我只是想知道是怎么回事.
sentences.en: I just wondered what was keeping you.

sentences.en: I about the magic number for a while and wondered whether there might be any others.

sentences.cn: 我想知道这是否是因为文化的原因.
sentences.en: I wondered if it was a cultural thing.

sentences.cn: 我想知道你何时离开.
sentences.en: I wonder when you will leave.

sentences.cn: 敏感的读者会想知道,这是否意味着两代人收入之间存在着高度的流动性.
sentences.en: Sensible readers will be wondering whether that suggests a lot of intergenerational income mobility or not.

sentences.cn: 我想知道天地万物万世的奥秘.
sentences.en: I wonder to learn the secrets of heaven and earth.

sentences.cn: 我想知道你们是否有雪莲牌羊毛衫?
sentences.en: I wonder if you stock any XueLian sweaters?

sentences.cn: 她坐立不安,她想知道什么是她的错.
sentences.en: She fidgeted and wondered what was wrong with her.

sentences.cn: 我很想知道人死后还能干些什么.
sentences.en: I wonder what the dead person would have done.

sentences.cn: 我想知道约翰甚么时候有新车.
sentences.en: I wonder when John got the new car.

sentences.cn: 我想知道你是否需要请人帮你割草.
sentences.en: I wondering whether you need anyone to cut your grass.

sentences.cn: 我是多么想知道你肌肤的触感和你鼻子的形状.
sentences.en: I wonder about your skin tone and shape of your nose?

sentences.cn: 我想知道其他人是否也有类似的经历.
sentences.en: I was wondering if anyone has had a similar experience.

sentences.cn: 我想知道你们的价格会不会有什么变化.
sentences.en: I wonder whether there are any changes in your prices.

sentences.cn: 我想知道他是否真正明白了.
sentences.en: I wonder if he's really taking it in.

sentences.cn: 他们惊讶地默默凝视那奇景.
sentences.en: They stared at the strange sight in silent wonder.

sentences.cn: 但见街道连绵不断,商店琳琅满目,车马熙来攘往,我们愈感惊讶不已.
sentences.en: We wondered more andat theof the streets the brilliancy of the shops the great traffic.

sentences.cn: 我一直对你很友好,你的无礼真叫我惊讶.
sentences.en: I wonder at your rudeness, when I have always been so kind to you.

sentences.cn: 几个女孩惊讶地盯着她的新裙子.
sentences.en: The girls gazed in wonder at her new dress.

sentences.cn: 戈达德的科学家感到惊讶, 怀疑这一申明是否发出了削弱其它中心作用的信号.
sentences.en: Goddard scientists, caught by surprise, wondered if the arrangement signaled a diminished role for their center.

sentences.cn: 埃尔莎坐着,惊讶地看了看自己白皙的小手和十个笨拙的手指.
sentences.en: Elsa sat and looked with wonder at her little white hands and the ten useless fingers.

sentences.cn: 就在这一天之内, 他的思想状况由惊讶变成了喜悦.
sentences.en: As the day passed, his state of mind passed from wonder to delight.

sentences.cn: 我第一次看见火车时真是惊讶不已.
sentences.en: I was struck with wonder as I saw the train for the first time.

sentences.cn: 那情景令人厌恶也是可以不发生的, 我很惊讶为什么孩子不在走道里.
sentences.en: It obscene, unnecessary and I wondered why the children were not in the aisles.

sentences.cn: 正是因为以上的种种,他四年前的这些话一点都不令人惊讶.
sentences.en: At this point, employees wondered why we were keeping such rebellious boy.

sentences.cn: 我对她青春常驻感到惊讶.
sentences.en: I wonder at her perennial youthfulness.

sentences.cn: 我对他在会上睡着了并不感到惊讶, 他太累了.
sentences.en: I don't wonder at his falling asleep at the meeting; he's too tired.

sentences.cn: 她对他的无礼感到惊讶.
sentences.en: She wonders at his rudeness.

sentences.cn: 我对他的学识感到惊讶.
sentences.en: I wonder at his learning.

sentences.cn: 能这样的话, 当你查看你的钟或手表时会惊讶 吗 ?
sentences.en: How can this be so, you may wonder as you look at your clock or watch?

sentences.cn: 有人可能对此感到惊讶,为什么昂宿星会希望摧毁一个包托邦形态的太阳系?
sentences.en: One may wonder why the Pleiadians would wish to destroy a utopia type solar system?

sentences.cn: 她只有独自一个在那里沉思和惊讶.
sentences.en: She was left to herself to brood and wonder.

sentences.cn: 相反, 人们就如伟人经过般惊奇, 并惊讶怎么会如此!
sentences.en: Instead, they marvelled as the Great Being passed, and wondered how it could be so!

sentences.cn: 我对她的粗鲁感到惊讶.
sentences.en: I wonder at her rudeness.

sentences.cn: 我对你允许她做这样的事感到惊讶.
sentences.en: I wonder at your allowing her to do such a thing.

sentences.cn: 小潘认为这是不讲道理、不近人情的虐待,他感到惊讶 、 困感 、 愤怒, 但又无可奈何.
sentences.en: Pen was bewildered with wonder, perplexity, fury, at this monstrous and unreasonable persecution.

sentences.cn: 他看到的只是这条狗, 脸上露出极为惊讶的神色.
sentences.en: He had eyes for the dog, and a great wonder came into his face.

sentences.cn: 马科对他父亲头脑里有那么渊博的知识,似乎从不感到惊讶.
sentences.en: Marco never seemed to wonder at the immense collection of facts in his father's head.

sentences.cn: 她在惊讶得朦朦胧胧的情况下摇了摇头.
sentences.en: She shook her head in drowsy wonder.

sentences.cn: 我非常惊讶,哑囗无言地看着他.
sentences.en: I looked at him in silent wonder.

sentences.cn: 西丝忽然转过头来, 表示着惊讶 、 怜悯悲愁.
sentences.en: Sissy had suddenly turned her head, and looked, in wonder, in pity, in sorrow.

sentences.cn: 他很惊讶,在这样的危机中,她竟泰然自若.
sentences.en: He wondered at her composure in such a crisis.

sentences.cn: 她想当歌手,我不应该感到惊讶.
sentences.en: I shouldn't wonder but she wants to be a singer.

sentences.cn: 也就没有谁会对法国舆论没有改革共识感到惊讶了.
sentences.en: No wonder there is no consensus for reform.

sentences.cn: 我在那看到你觉得惊讶.
sentences.en: I wondered to see you there.

Sentence.sentence: Some scholars think teamwork may not always be reliable, despite its potential to work wonders.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yes, I wonder when I'll be informed about my application for the job.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When I look at my friendship with Joe, I wonder how many people I've known whom I never disliked, but simply didn't take the time to get to know.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But I wonder how he could get a job when he looks like that.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if I broke something.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Guests would fall silent in wonder as servants carried Careme's fancy creations into the dining hall.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: I wonder how they make it entertaining.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Some people wonder why countries spend millions of dollars on space projects.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: This led her to wonder if people might be doing the same thing.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C
